results.title: Scan Results
results.noResults: No results yet. Run a scan to discover clean IPs.

advanced.title: Multi-Vector DPI Bypassing
advanced.fragDesc: Test every permutation of length and interval pairs against the target IP to find a DPI bypass sweet spot for your current ISP.
advanced.sniDesc: Iterates through a massive list of SNIs against a single working Cloudflare IP.

warp.title: WARP Endpoint Scanner
warp.desc: Hunt for fully functional Cloudflare WARP UDP/TCP nodes tailored to your region. You can use these IPs as Wireguard endpoints to establish full-device VPN tunnels that bypass DPI censorship.

dnsScanner.title: DNS & Tunnel Scanner (BETA)
dnsScanner.subtitle: Test DNS resolver overrides and TLS Split-Stream fragmentation to bypass DPI censorship.
dnsScanner.nameserverDesc: Supports UDP, TCP, DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH), and DNS-over-TLS (DoT) formats.
dnsScanner.testDomainDesc: Domain to try resolving through the selected DNS server.
dnsScanner.fragmentSizeDesc: Example: '10-20' segments packets between 10 and 20 bytes.
dnsScanner.packetModeDesc: tlshello splits only the TLS handshake. 1-3 splits the first 1-3 TCP data writes.
dnsScanner.fingerprintDesc: Mimics real browser TLS handshakes to evade DPI fingerprint detection.
dnsScanner.errorNoConfig: Please paste a valid Xray/V2Ray config first.

dnsGuide.beginnerTitle: üìñ Beginner Guide ‚Äî How to Use This Tab
dnsGuide.step1Desc: Select 'DNS Resolver Override' to test if your ISP is poisoning DNS queries, or 'TLS Split-Stream' to fragment your TLS handshake and bypass DPI censorship.
dnsGuide.step2Desc: For DNS mode: Pick a DNS server from the dropdown (DoH recommended for censored regions). For TLS Split: Select your ISP preset or manually set fragment size and interval.
dnsGuide.step3Desc: Choose a TLS fingerprint (Chrome recommended) so your traffic looks like normal browser activity to DPI systems.
dnsGuide.step4Desc: Paste a working VLESS/Trojan config (vless://... or trojan://...) into the text box, then press Start Scanner. The app will launch Xray with your settings and test connectivity.
dnsGuide.proTipDesc: If you're in Iran, start with the 'Iran MCI' or 'Iran Irancell' preset and Chrome fingerprint. If it fails, try DoH (Google or Cloudflare) instead of plain DNS.
dnsGuide.tlsP1: When you connect to a website over HTTPS, the very first message your computer sends is called the 'TLS ClientHello'. This message contains the SNI (Server Name Indication) ‚Äî the hostname you're trying to visit (e.g., youtube.com).
dnsGuide.tlsP2: Government firewalls read this SNI to decide whether to block your connection. TLS Split-Stream defeats this by splitting the ClientHello into tiny fragments. The firewall sees incomplete pieces and can't reconstruct the hostname.
dnsGuide.tlsHelloDesc: Splits ONLY the TLS ClientHello. Most effective and targeted. Use this first.
dnsGuide.mode13Desc: Splits the first 1-3 data writes. Broader but less targeted. Try if tlshello fails.
dnsGuide.sizeIntervalDesc: Size = bytes per fragment (smaller = harder to detect). Interval = delay in ms between fragments.
dnsGuide.dnsP1: When your ISP censors the internet, one of the first things they do is poison DNS queries. When you try to resolve 'youtube.com', your ISP returns a fake IP address or blocks the response entirely.
dnsGuide.dnsP2: DNS Resolver Override routes your Xray DNS queries through a different server ‚Äî bypassing your ISP's poisoned DNS. You can use encrypted protocols like DoH (DNS-over-HTTPS) so your ISP can't even see what you're resolving.
dnsGuide.utlsP1: Every program creates a unique 'TLS fingerprint' when it connects to a server. Government DPI systems can detect that you're using Xray/V2Ray instead of a real browser by analyzing this fingerprint.
dnsGuide.utlsP2: uTLS solves this by mimicking the exact TLS handshake of real browsers. When you select 'Chrome', your Xray connection looks identical to Google Chrome to any observer.
dnsGuide.utlsWarningDesc: Iranian ISPs (especially MCI and Irancell) actively detect non-browser TLS fingerprints. Always select Chrome or Firefox to avoid detection.
dnsGuide.ispP1: Different ISPs use different DPI (Deep Packet Inspection) systems with varying detection capabilities. Fragment settings that work on one ISP may not work on another.
dnsGuide.ispMci: Most aggressive DPI in Iran. Uses ML-based analysis. Needs large fragments (100-200 bytes) with moderate delays.
dnsGuide.ispIrancell: Strong DPI but less aggressive than MCI. Medium fragments (50-100 bytes) usually work well.
dnsGuide.ispShatel: Lighter DPI. Small, fast fragments (10-30 bytes, 1-5ms delay) are very effective.
dnsGuide.ispChina: Advanced stateful DPI. Medium fragments with longer delays (20-50ms) to avoid detection.

about.title: Antigravity IP Scanner
about.subtitle: Advanced Cloudflare IP Optimization & Censorship Bypass Tool

whatIs.title: What is Antigravity?
whatIs.p1: Antigravity is a professional-grade network tool designed to discover and verify Cloudflare Edge IPs and WARP endpoints that bypass Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) and geographic censorship.
whatIs.p2: It tests latency (ping), jitter, and real-world download/upload speeds to find the best connections for your specific internet provider and location.

s1.title: Get a VLESS Config
s1.desc: You need a working VLESS configuration as a base. You can:
sub: Paste your own config directly into the text box
Enter a subscription URL and click 'Fetch Config' to auto-import
Use the 'üî• ONE-CLICK AUTO SCAN' button (it fetches configs automatically)

s2.title: Choose Your IP Source
s2.desc: Select where to find IPs to test:
sub: üìÇ Official Cloudflare ‚Äî Fresh IPs from Cloudflare's ranges
üß† Smart History ‚Äî IPs verified on your exact ISP before
üèÜ Gold IPs ‚Äî Smartest strategy: combines history + community + scraped domains
üë• Community Gold ‚Äî IPs verified by other users in your country

s3.title: Configure Thresholds (Optional)
sub: Max Ping ‚Äî Reject IPs slower than this (default: 800ms)
Min Download ‚Äî Reject slow downloads (default: 1 Mbps)
Concurrency ‚Äî How many IPs to test in parallel (default: 8)

s4.title: Start Scanning
s4.desc: Click 'START SCAN' and watch results appear in real-time. The scanner stops automatically after finding enough good IPs.

s5.title: Use Your Results
sub: Click 'Copy Link' to copy any good IP's VLESS config
Click 'Export' to generate a subscription link for V2RayNG / Clash
Results are sorted by speed ‚Äî the top rows are your best IPs

tls.title: üîí Strict TLS Verification
tls.desc: Validates that the server's TLS certificate belongs to Cloudflare before allowing traffic. Prevents Man-In-The-Middle attacks.

dpi.title: üß© DPI Fragment Analyzer
dpi.desc: Tests various V2Ray fragment configurations on a single IP to bypass advanced deep packet inspection firewalls.

tcp.title: ‚ö° TCP Pre-Filter
tcp.desc: Instantly drops dead IPs using an ultra-fast raw TCP connection test before initiating heavy Xray proxy engines.

queue.title: üíæ Persistent Background Queue
queue.desc: Pure SQLite asynchronous scan queue ensures your heavy scans survive application restarts and crashes.

fastly.title: ‚ö° Fastly CDN Native Support
fastly.desc: Built-in intelligence to natively discover and verify Fastly Edge Network IPs alongside Cloudflare.

dnstt.title: üõ°Ô∏è DNSTT & TLS Split-Stream
dnstt.desc: Dedicated Beta scanner for SlowDNS encapsulation and fragmented packet analysis to shatter deep DPI layers.

sni.title: üåê SNI Fronting Scanner
sni.desc: Scans a working IP against hundreds of domain names to find unblocked SNIs for disguised routing.

warp.title: üì° WARP Endpoint Scanner
warp.desc: Discovers Cloudflare WARP UDP endpoints for Wireguard-based VPN clients.

map.title: üìä Global Analytics
map.desc: Interactive world heatmap showing scan results across all countries.

retry.title: üîÑ Smart Retry System
retry.desc: If strict thresholds find nothing, the scanner automatically retries with relaxed settings.

dns_override.title: üåê DNS Resolver Override
dns_override.desc: Routes DNS queries through encrypted DoH/DoT servers to bypass ISP DNS poisoning and censorship.

macos.title: üçé macOS Support
macos.desc: Native macOS DMG installer available. Run Antigravity Scanner on both Windows and macOS.

tips.title: Tips for Best Results
list: Enable the 'System Proxy' checkbox if you have a VPN active
The 'üî• ONE-CLICK AUTO SCAN' button is the easiest way to start
If no good IPs are found, try 'Official Cloudflare' source
Lower Min Download to 1-2 Mbps if getting too few results
Run scans during off-peak hours for better speeds
Use 'Advanced Bypasses' tab for DPI fragmentation testing
Export results as subscription link for V2RayNG
WARP scanner works without any V2Ray configs

items.a: A clean IP is a Cloudflare Edge server IP that is not blocked or throttled by your ISP. By finding unblocked IPs, you bypass censorship.

items.q: Is this app safe to use?
items.a: Yes. The app only connects to Cloudflare's infrastructure. Configs are never uploaded to any third party.
Each IP requires Xray startup, warmup, 6 pings, and speed tests. This takes 15-30 seconds per IP.
The IP could not establish a connection. It's likely blocked by your ISP or the config is invalid.
VLESS is a proxy protocol needing a V2Ray config. WARP is Cloudflare's own VPN using Wireguard ‚Äî no separate server needed.

items.q: Can I use this on my phone?
items.a: The scanner runs on Windows, but results (VLESS links) work in any V2Ray client on any platform.

privacy.title: Privacy & Security
items: Your VLESS configs are NEVER uploaded ‚Äî they stay 100% local
Scan results (IP, ping, speed) are stored in a shared database to help other users
All tests go through Cloudflare's own infrastructure
Your public IP is detected via ip-api.com solely for ISP matching
No analytics trackers, no ads, no telemetry ‚Äî fully open source
